titles.title: Mäṣḥafä ḫǝmamatihu wä-zena sǝqlätu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos “Book of the Passion and Story of the Crucifixion of Jesus Christ” / Täʾamrä [täzkarä] motu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos “Miracles Concerning the Commemoration of the Death of Our Saviour Jesus Christ” / Gädlä Täklä Maryam “Vita of Täklä Maryam (Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon)” / Miracles of the Saviour of the World worked by ʾabunä Täklä Maryam / Mästäbqwǝʿ zä-mäsqäl “Supplication of the Cross”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Mäṣḥafä ḫǝmamatihu wä-zena sǝqlätu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos “Book of the Passion and Story of the Crucifixion of Jesus Christ” (fols. 2ra-54rb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 2ra-3rb) I-2) Homily for Mäggabit (fols. 3rb-6vb) I-3) Homily for Miyazya (entitled Zena sǝqlätu lä-ʾǝgziʾǝnä ʾIyäsus Krǝstos “Story of the Crucifixion of Our Lord Jesus Christ”) containing the life of Jesus Christ (fols. 6vb-10vb) and 4 homilies (fols. 11ra-16ra) I-4) Homily for Gǝnbot (fols. 16ra-18ra) I-5) Homily for Säne (fols.18rb-20ra) I-6) Homily for Ḥamle (fols. 20ra-22ra) I-7) Homily for Näḥase (fols. 22ra-26rb) I-8) Homily for Mäskäräm (fols. 26rb-28va) I-9) Homily for Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 28va-31va) I-10) Homily for Ḫǝdar (fols. 31va-33va) I-11) Homily for Taḫśas (fols. 33va-36rb) I-12) Homily for Ṭǝrr (fols. 36rb-39va) II) Täʾamrä [täzkarä] motu lä-ʾIyäsus Krǝstos “Miracles Concerning the Commemoration of the Death of Our Saviour Jesus Christ” containing 4 miracles and a concluding part, for Yäkkatit (fols. 39va-54rb) III) Gädlä Täklä Maryam “Vita of Täklä Maryam (Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon)” (fols. 54rb-74va) IV) Miracles of the Saviour of the World worked by ʾabunä Täklä Maryam (fols. 74va-76ra) IV-1) How the saint healed a child with the swollen throat (fol. 74va-74vb) (cf. EMML no. 3420, fol. 192b) IV-2) How ʾabunä Täklä Maryam healed a sick child who was near death (fol. 75ra-75vb) (cf. EMML no. 3420, fol. 193a) IV-3) About light that appeared over the dough from which the bread for the commemoration of the Saviour was made (fols. 75vb-76ra) (cf. EMML no. 1779, fol. 71b) V) Mästäbqwǝʿ zä-mäsqäl “Supplication of the Cross” (fols. 76rb-77vb).

copyists.copyist: The scribe, ʿƎnqwä Śǝllase, is mentioned in the supplication formula on fols. 39va ls. 6-7, 45vb l.11. Gäbrä ʾIyäsus is a secondary scribe who wrote (in strong vermillion) the names of the months in the upper margins and names of the secondary donors. He is mentioned in the supplication formulas on fols. 13rb and 16ra.

donors.donor:
The original donors are mentioned in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms.: Wäldä Śǝllase (e.g., fols. 3rb, 10vb, 13rb, 14rb, 30ra), his father Wäldä ʿAbiyä ʾƎgziʾ (e.g., fols. 62ra, 74rb), his mother Wälättä Haymanot (e.g., fols. 6vb, 10vb, 14rb), his wife Wälättä Mädḫǝn (e.g., fols. 13rb, 14rb, 22ra, 30ra), Zärʿa Yoḥannǝs (e.g., fol. 59vb). Also, they are mentioned in the concluding supplication on fol. 76ra.
Other names have been written later over the names of the original donors: Wäldä Rufaʾel (e.g., fols. 3rb, 10vb, 13va), Wälättä Śǝllase (e.g., fols. 6vb, 13rb), Gäbrä Mikaʾel (e.g., fol. 11ra), Gäbrä ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer (fol. 20ra), Wälättä Ḥǝywät (e.g., fol. 20ra), Wäldä Kidan (e.g., fol. 23vb), Wälättä Krǝstos (e.g., fol. 24ra). They are rubricated in strong vermilion.

txstates.txstate: The front board is broken and repaired. The sewing is partly damaged. Some fols. are stained with water and wax.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible in the centre fold and on the spine fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(1; s.l.: 1, stub after 1/fol. 1) – I(8/fols. 2r-9v) – II(8/fols. 10r-17v) – III(8/fols. 18r-25v) – IV(8/fols. 26r-33v) – V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 34r-41v) – VI(7; s.l.: 5, stub after 2/fols. 42r-48v) – VII(10/fols. 49r-58v) – VIII(9; s.l.: 6, stub after 3/fols. 59r-67v) – IX(8/fols. 68r-75v) – X(2; s.l.: 1, stub before 1; 2, stub before1/fols. 76r-77v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/B. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the protagonist; names of the donors and the scribe; a few lines on the incipit page of Text I; 1st and 2nd lines of the incipit of Texts II-IV; the initial line of Text V; one or two initial lines of the sections of Texts I, II, III; names of the months; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements. Names of the months and names of the secondary donors are rubricated in strong vermillion.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Gädlä Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon and Miracles of the Saviour of the World worked by ʾabunä Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon are contained also in Mäṣḥafä lä-täzkarä Mädḫane ʿAläm “Book of Commemoration of the Saviour of the World” (s. MR-016 and FBM-004). - Gädlä Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon (fols. 54rb l.8-74va l.3) is assigned for the month Mäggabit, s. fol. 54r: ዘአቡነ፡ መብዓ፡ ጽዮን፡ ዘይትነበብ በወርኃ፡ መጋቢት ʻOf ʾabunä Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon is read in the month of Mäggabitʼ.

extras.extra: - A few lines of a text have been erased from fol. 76vb. - Scribbles: fols. 1, 76r, 77.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Text I is divided into monthly readings indicated by the names of the months written in the upper margin: fols. 2r, 11r, 16r, 18r, 20r, 22r, 26r, 28v, 31v, 33v, 36r, 39v.
